nodes.name: Equipping AI with Theory of Mind (ToM) can enhance its social intelligence and improve interactions with humans.
Understanding the attribution of mental states to AI can facilitate the design of AI systems that align with human expectations and mental models.
The emerging concept of Mutual Theory of Mind (MToM) suggests that both humans and AI can possess ToM capabilities, enhancing collaborative interactions.
Theory of Mind in Human-AI Interaction
nodes.keywords: ['Theory of Mind', 'Social Intelligence', 'Human-AI Interaction', 'AI Development', 'Mutual Theory of Mind']

nodes.name: Application of human-AI interaction guidelines leads to improved user perceptions compared to when guidelines are violated.
Optimal AI performance enhances user perceptions when guidelines are applied.
Sub-optimal AI performance negatively affects user perceptions, particularly when guidelines are not followed.
Assessing Human-AI Interaction Early through Factorial Surveys: A Study on the Guidelines for Human-AI Interaction
AI systems can enhance user satisfaction in prayer experiences by aligning with identified user goals and behaviors.
AI can act as a catalyst for provoking deep reflections among users during their prayer experiences.
AI has the potential to foster and create indirect communities around shared experiences of prayer.
Spiritual AI: Exploring the Possibilities of a Human-AI Interaction Beyond Productive Goals
Alternative human-AI interaction models can enhance clinician involvement in clinical decision-making.
AI-driven user interfaces impact the nature of clinical decision-making scenarios.
Development and translation of human-AI interaction models into working prototypes for clinical decision-making
Explainable AI can facilitate trust in human-AI interactions.
Affective means play a significant role in the processing of trust related to Explainable AI.
The depth of information presentation, beyond explanations, significantly influences trust formation.
Exploration of Explainable AI for Trust Development on Human-AI Interaction
Deleting unused apps can lead to significant user burdens that affect user experience.
A conversational agent designed for reporting sexual assault cases can alleviate some burdens faced by survivors.
Employee resistance to algorithmic evaluations indicates underlying user burdens related to trust and transparency.
Re-examining User Burden in Human-AI Interaction: Focusing on a Domain-Specific Approach
nodes.keywords: ['User burden', 'Application management', 'Conversational agent', 'Workplace evaluations', 'Sexual assault reporting']

nodes.name: Current practices in developing appropriate trust in AI systems are diverse and lack a unified definition.
A systematic review of literature highlights both commonalities and disagreements in defining appropriate trust in AI.
Proposed Belief, Intentions, and Actions (BIA) mapping can facilitate understanding of concepts related to trust in AI systems.
Identified challenges in studying trust present research opportunities for enhancing human-AI interactions.
A Systematic Review on Fostering Appropriate Trust in Human-AI Interaction: Trends, Opportunities and Challenges
AI products following HAI guidelines are generally more inclusive of diverse problem-solving styles than those that do not.
Inclusivity of an AI product varies significantly based on the adherence to specific guidelines and user problem-solving styles.
Increased control offered by an AI product correlates with higher inclusivity for users.
AI products' learning from users' personal data affects the inclusivity experienced by users.
Problem-solving styles of users are differently represented across gender and age demographics.
Findings indicate actionable improvements for HAI practitioners to enhance product inclusivity.
Measuring User Experience Inclusivity in Human-AI Interaction via Five User Problem-Solving Styles
Three types of human-AI interaction paradigms have been identified: intermittent, continuous, and proactive.
Current human-AI interaction research primarily focuses on intermittent interaction scenarios.
There is a need for systematic exploration of techniques to support users in non-intermittent AI interaction scenarios.
Human-AI interaction: intermittent, continuous, and proactive
Three distinct paradigms of human-AI interaction (Intermittent, Continuous, Proactive) exhibit different characteristics in supported goals.
User control varies significantly among the three interaction paradigms, impacting user experience.
Qualitative user interviews highlight unique challenges and opportunities within each interaction paradigm.
Designing for Human-AI Interaction: Comparing Intermittent, Continuous, and Proactive Interactions for a Music Application
End-users prefer practical information in XAI that enhances collaboration with AI.
Users intend to use XAI explanations for trust calibration and skills improvement.
Participants favor part-based explanations resembling human reasoning over technical details.
"Help Me Help the AI": Understanding How Explainability Can Support Human-AI Interaction
Placebo effects can influence user expectations and outcomes in human-computer interaction research involving artificial intelligence.
The integration of placebo control measures in experimental designs can help mitigate the impact of placebo effects in user studies.
Evaluating Interactive AI: Understanding and Controlling Placebo Effects in Human-AI Interaction
Participants depict AI entities through various forms, including devices and human figures, reflecting diverse perceptions of AI.
User-generated mind maps of AI highlight potential risks in human-AI interaction, informing design considerations.
Design improvements for human-AI interaction can be enhanced by leveraging existing user perceptions of AI.
AI in Your Mind: Counterbalancing Perceived Agency and Experience in Human-AI Interaction
The proposed design guidelines for human-AI interaction were validated through evaluations involving design practitioners.
Evaluation results demonstrate the relevance of the guidelines across various interaction scenarios with AI-infused products.
There were identified gaps in current knowledge regarding human-AI interaction design, indicating areas for future research.
Guidelines for Human-AI Interaction
nodes.keywords: ['User Interface Design', 'Design Guidelines', 'AI Technologies', 'Product Testing', 'Human-AI Interaction']

nodes.name: Alternative human-AI interactions can promote a more sustainable and equitable future by fostering ecological thinking.
Design principles proposed in the paper aim to guide AI development towards nurturing a caring human-ecology relationship.
AI as a Child of Mother Earth: Regrounding Human-AI Interaction in Ecological Thinking
The adaptation of Stable Diffusion for a game facilitates the exploration of players' misconceptions about AI systems.
Engaging users in a social human-AI interaction game promotes discussions that help clarify and evolve their mental models regarding AI.
Playing with Dezgo: Adapting Human-AI Interaction to the Context of Play
Different designs of explainable AI interfaces can significantly influence human decision making.
Utilizing estimation tasks as a research method effectively measures the effects of XAI interface designs.
The representation of LIME explanations in decision support systems can impact the accuracy of human estimations.
Interfaces for Explanations in Human-AI Interaction: Proposing a Design Evaluation Approach
Trust is a multi-faceted and important topic within human-AI interaction contexts.
Current literature on trust in AI is generally under-theorized and under-reported.
Established trust models are rarely utilized in the study of trust in AI systems.
There is a lack of detailed reporting about trust measurement methods in existing research.
Research agenda proposed includes targets for systematic review to enhance trust literature in AI.
Trust in Human-AI Interaction: Scoping Out Models, Measures, and Methods
Designers of mental health technologies aim to create comprehensive care platforms but often prioritize either consumer or physician needs, leading to fragmented care solutions.
Evaluation challenges in the development of AI platforms result in a piecemeal demonstration of effectiveness, impacting overall patient journeys.
The influence of the data economy and designer mindsets contributes to unintended consequences in the design of AI-enhanced health technologies.
Societal-Scale Human-AI Interaction Design? How Hospitals and Companies are Integrating Pervasive Sensing into Mental Healthcare
Chaining LLM steps can improve the quality of task outcomes for users.
Chaining LLM steps enhances system transparency and controllability for users.
Users develop innovative interaction methods with LLMs through the implementation of Chains.
AI Chains: Transparent and Controllable Human-AI Interaction by Chaining Large Language Model Prompts
Interactive machine learning tools enable coaches to incorporate their extensive domain knowledge, enhancing the accuracy of predictions for marathons.
Coaches who interacted with the predictive model exhibited increased trust and acceptance towards the predictions it generated.
Benefits of Human-AI Interaction for Expert Users Interacting with Prediction Models: a Study on Marathon Running
Direction of communication affects players' social perceptions of AI agents in cooperative game settings.
Participants exhibit significant differences in social perception based on whether they believe they are interacting with an AI or a human partner.
The bias against AI agents varies based on the communication roles and styles in the interaction.
Effects of Communication Directionality and AI Agent Differences in Human-AI Interaction
Designing polyadic conversational agents with social boundaries, such as privacy and disclosure, is essential for ethical interactions among users.
There is a need to advance usability testing methods for polyadic conversational agents to enhance user experience.
Trust-building guidelines for conversational AI are necessary for fostering effective human interactions in polyadic settings.
UX Research on Conversational Human-AI Interaction: A Literature Review of the ACM Digital Library
AI-enabled applications designed with a focus on Human-AI interaction guidelines may not align with ethical guidelines for trustworthy AI.
The analysis of Strava and CoronaMelder revealed a lack of compliance between HAI interaction design and ethical AI guidelines.
Human-AI interaction and ethics of AI: how well are we following the guidelines
Interactive forward reasoning designs in AI decision support systems can effectively manage output uncertainty.
Involvement of users in the decision-making process enhances the effectiveness of AI systems in high-stakes applications.
A broader design perspective that includes both backward and forward reasoning is essential for improving AI deployment in critical contexts.
Forward Reasoning Decision Support: Toward a More Complete View of the Human-AI Interaction Design Space
nodes.keywords: ['Decision Support Systems', 'Output Uncertainty', 'Interactive Design', 'Forward Reasoning', 'High-Stakes Applications']

nodes.name: AI-to-human communication enhances user engagement and collaborative experience during co-creation tasks.
Users perceive co-creative AI as more reliable, personal, and intelligent when it is capable of communicating with them.
Understanding User Perceptions, Collaborative Experience and User Engagement in Different Human-AI Interaction Designs for Co-Creative Systems
Students' perception of the virtual teaching assistant, Jill Watson, evolved significantly over time.
Linguistic features such as verbosity, readability, sentiment, diversity, and adaptability correlate with students' perception of Jill Watson.
The Mutual Theory of Mind framework enhances the design of adaptive conversational agents for long-term interactions.
Towards Mutual Theory of Mind in Human-AI Interaction: How Language Reflects What Students Perceive About a Virtual Teaching Assistant
AI systems can introduce unpredictability that negatively impacts user experience.
The complexity of AI outputs presents unique design challenges for human-AI interactions.
Identifying varying levels of AI systems aids designers in addressing specific design challenges effectively.
Re-examining Whether, Why, and How Human-AI Interaction Is Uniquely Difficult to Design
Human-AI loops in design often do not converge towards satisfactory results due to inconsistent human judgments.
Heuristic biases and loss aversion in users are influenced by machine outcomes, affecting future user inputs.
Descriptive UI design guidelines can help mitigate issues in human-in-the-loop systems.
The Human in the Infinite Loop: A Case Study on Revealing and Explaining Human-AI Interaction Loop Failures
The proposed fluid architecture enables bidirectional interaction between clients and servers in AI-powered applications.
The architecture supports servers initiating data requests from clients, enhancing real-time data exchange.
Dynamic adaptation of interfaces to intelligence updates is facilitated by the fluid architecture for better user experience.
Towards fluid software architectures: bidirectional human-AI interaction
Power users show greater trust in AI systems that present themselves as help-seekers compared to those that frame as help-providers.
Non-power users prefer AI systems that simultaneously portray themselves as both help-seekers and help-providers.
How Should AI Systems Talk to Users when Collecting their Personal Information? Effects of Role Framing and Self-Referencing on Human-AI Interaction
Employees experience six types of burdens towards AI in human resource management: emotional, mental, bias, manipulation, privacy, and social.
Transparency, interpretability, and human intervention can reduce employees' burdens regarding AI in performance evaluations.
Human-AI Interaction in Human Resource Management: Understanding Why Employees Resist Algorithmic Evaluation at Workplaces and How to Mitigate Burdens
Automated extraction of action conditions from human task demonstrations enhances robot task learning capabilities.
Utilizing correlation-based and decision tree-based feature selection methods improves the efficiency of behavior tree generation in robotic applications.
Learning Action Conditions for Automatic Behavior Tree Generation from Human Demonstrations
Defamiliarization of AI supports creative interpretation of ambiguous metaphors.
Explicit metaphorical thinking can help participants use ambiguity as a resource.
Ambiguous metaphorical thinking may assist groups in negotiating values.
The term AI may constrain processes aimed at defamiliarization.
Designing AI with Metaphors: Leveraging Ambiguity and Defamiliarization to Support Design Creativity
Self-voice alarms encourage more consistent daily task completion compared to beep sound alarms.
Self-voice alarms enhance user alertness and produce uncomfortable feelings during task reminders.
Both self-voice and other-voice alarms increase users’ perceived usefulness of alarm systems.
My Voice as a Daily Reminder: Self-Voice Alarm for Daily Goal Achievement
Collaborative tasks are performed more effectively when human-AI teams utilize an AI agent that adjusts its autonomy based on the situation.
Users report higher perceived intelligence of AI agents that adapt their autonomy during collaborative tasks.
An Evaluation of Situational Autonomy for Human-AI Collaboration in a Shared Workspace Setting
Specialized human-AI interaction systems can provide effective support and care for older adults with mild cognitive impairment.
A comprehensive dataset categorizing measurement tools for assessing older adults with cognitive impairments has been developed, enabling informed recommendations in AI applications.
Evaluation Tools for Human-AI Interactions Involving Older Adults with Mild Cognitive Impairments
AI-enhanced products require tailored user experience guidelines specific to the banking sector.
Practitioners express mixed feelings towards existing AI design resources, indicating a demand for improvement.
Understanding stakeholder dynamics is crucial for developing effective AI interaction strategies.
Understanding the Dynamics in Creating Domain-Specific AI Design Guidelines: A Case Study of a Leading Digital Finance Company in South Korea
GenAI systems impose significant metacognitive demands on users, requiring them to actively monitor and control their interactions with the technology.
Integrating metacognitive support strategies into GenAI systems can enhance user experience by reducing cognitive load.
Designing GenAI systems to improve explainability and customizability can lower the metacognitive demands placed on users.
The Metacognitive Demands and Opportunities of Generative AI
People expect AI agents' performance to be consistently better than that of human teammates across various problems.
Participants perceive less performance variation when assessing AI agents compared to human teammates.
Capturing Humans’ Mental Models of AI: An Item Response Theory Approach
HINT framework facilitates early testing of AI features in realistic user tasks, enabling iterative feedback.
Over-time testing reveals evolving user behaviors during interactions with AI systems, highlighting the importance of continuous evaluation.
HINT successfully identifies distinct user behavior patterns associated with various AI performance modalities during prototype testing.
Practitioner interviews indicate HINT's effectiveness in evaluating human-AI interaction experiences prior to deployment.
HINT: Integration Testing for AI-based features with Humans in the Loop
Students with special educational needs demonstrated a strong willingness to learn and use AI technology during game design workshops.
The text-to-image AI interaction helped students with fine motor skill challenges to effectively translate their ideas into digital images.
Engagement with text-to-image AI enhanced the students' skills in conveying ideas in writing and improving conceptualization abilities.
Students faced significant challenges in human-AI interaction, including difficulties with typing, spelling, and prompt writing.
Understanding Students’ Perspectives, Practices, and Challenges of Designing with AI in Special Schools
Trust in AI is significantly higher when model accuracy is high.
Behavioral trust remains stable and subjective trust increases when using high-accuracy models.
Human-like explanations enhance trust in high-accuracy models but do not generally affect trust levels in low-accuracy models.
It Seems Smart, but It Acts Stupid: Development of Trust in AI Advice in a Repeated Legal Decision-Making Task
nodes.keywords: ['Trust in AI', 'Model accuracy', 'Human-like explanations', 'Decision-making', 'Criminal law cases']

nodes.name: AI can expand the understanding of human-AI interactions beyond productivity-focused paradigms.
Game designs should incorporate flow to enhance the learning curve of human-AI interactions.
Discovery-based learning encourages users to experiment with AI, facilitating a deeper understanding of interactions.
Inviting users to play with AI can lead to the exploration of new forms of human-AI interaction.
Player-AI Interaction: What Neural Network Games Reveal About AI as Play
AI-driven tools mainly assist in the generation and execution of ideas rather than in the initial stages of creativity.
Human-AI interaction issues identified in other domains are not adequately addressed in the context of creative processes.
Future AI tools can enhance innovation by utilizing the unique qualities of AI in a collaborative and human-centered manner.
Too Late to be Creative? AI-Empowered Tools in Creative Processes
AI-based system, AlphaDAPR, can facilitate large-scale automatic drawing assessments, aiding art therapists in understanding psychological states.
A majority of art therapists expressed a willingness to adopt the AI system for drawing assessments.
The integration of explainable AI in interface design enhances perceived usefulness, trust, satisfaction, and intention to use among art therapists.
Art therapists demonstrated high intention to use the AI system, alongside concerns regarding its limitations and threats.
AlphaDAPR: An AI-based Explainable Expert Support System for Art Therapy
Safety drivers manage the risks associated with defective algorithms in Autonomous Vehicles during real-world traffic tasks.
Safety drivers face limitations in personal and professional development when working with Autonomous Vehicles.
The experiences of safety drivers provide new insights into the challenges and dynamics of human-AI interaction in the context of Autonomous Vehicles.
Work with AI and Work for AI: Autonomous Vehicle Safety Drivers’ Lived Experiences
Personalized predictive models can significantly enhance the accuracy of individual human behavior in chess.
Fine-tuning methods applied to AI can align its predictions more closely with individual player decision-making.
Models developed for personalized prediction can facilitate stylometry, allowing for the identification of individual players based on their moves.
Learning Models of Individual Behavior in Chess
AI assistants with different values do not significantly alter users' self-evaluation of idea quality or perception of assistant competence.
The values embedded in AI assistants influence the generated ideas, reflecting the AI's values.
User feelings of ownership over generated ideas are affected by the values present in the AI's output.
Exploring the Impact of AI Value Alignment in Collaborative Ideation: Effects on Perception, Ownership, and Output
AI-based choreography-support system can facilitate rapid ideation of diverse and novel dance sequences.
The generative AI model aids in iterative digital dance prototyping by allowing for editing and modification of motion sequences.
Exploring AI-assisted Ideation and Prototyping for Choreography
AI systems designed to be fair and transparent can enhance human performance in the workplace.
Implementing explainable AI can foster trust and reliability in human-AI interactions.
Human-in-the-loop methods contribute to improved dynamics and workflows between human users and AI systems.
Using human-in-the-loop and explainable AI to envisage new future work practices
AI systems can effectively adapt to continuous user input in applications such as image-guided surgery and AI-supported text entry.
Traditional guidelines for AI interactions may hinder user needs in scenarios requiring continuous engagement.
Improved methods for designing continuous Human-AI interaction can enhance the overall user experience and effectiveness of AI applications.
Designing for Continuous Interaction with Artificial Intelligence Systems
AI can stimulate audience engagement and reflection on linguistic taboos through immersive experiences.
Generative models can provide visual representations that challenge the constraints of language.
AI has the ability to comprehend and interpret censored words, raising ethical considerations in communication.
Artistic installations can serve as a medium to explore the intersection of language, censorship, and technology.
Ephemera: Language as a Virus - AI-driven Interactive and Immersive Art Installation
Creative exploration of tangible interaction with AI can provide new design perspectives for researchers.
Participants found envisioning physicality and tangible interaction with AI to be challenging and abstract.
The exploration process encouraged participants to move beyond traditional anthropomorphic designs for AI.
Making AI Understandable by Making it Tangible: Exploring the Design Space with Ten Concept Cards
Generative AI can enhance personalized self-care by providing tailored advice and suggestions.
Generative AI facilitates creative reflection in self-care practices through interactive dialogue and varied content generation.
The use of generative AI for self-care raises concerns regarding the accuracy and trustworthiness of the advice given.
Studying Self-Care with Generative AI Tools: Lessons for Design
AI agents that accept blame and offer sincere apologies are perceived as more intelligent than those that deflect blame.
Sincere apologies increase the likability of AI agents in situations where errors occur.
AI agents considered more effective in error recovery openly accept responsibility for their mistakes.
Owning Mistakes Sincerely: Strategies for Mitigating AI Errors
Proposed approach uses externalization of vulnerability and verbalization of thoughts to evaluate user trust in AI systems more effectively.
Externalizing Vulnerability and Verbalizing Thoughts to More Adequately Evaluate Trust in AI
The AI-DEC design method enables workers to create AI explanations tailored to their diverse performance and autonomy needs.
End-users can engage effectively in the design of AI explanations using AI-DEC, leading to better alignment with their expectations.
The AI-DEC: A Card-based Design Method for User-centered AI Explanations
Grammar-Preserving Text Saliency Modulation (GP-TSM) improves text rendering by making important information more salient through a recursive sentence compression method.
Participants preferred GP-TSM over traditional word-level rendering methods, indicating enhanced usability and preference for this approach.
Participants demonstrated greater efficiency in answering GRE reading comprehension questions when using GP-TSM compared to other methods.
An AI-Resilient Text Rendering Technique for Reading and Skimming Documents
Interactive system RELIC helps users assess the reliability of text generated by Large Language Models (LLMs).
Users can investigate and verify variations in generated long-form responses to recognize potentially inaccurate information.
The approach demonstrated effectiveness in enhancing users' ability to verify generated text reliability.
RELIC: Investigating Large Language Model Responses using Self-Consistency
Context-adaptive AI systems can enhance user experiences through improved interaction design tools.
The integration of safety-guaranteed AI systems in robotics allows for adaptive responses to unexpected situations.
User participation in AI explanation design leads to better end-user adoption and satisfaction.
Design, Development, and Deployment of Context-Adaptive AI Systems for Enhanced User Adoption
nodes.keywords: ['User-centered design', 'Context-adaptive AI', 'Safety in AI', 'Practical applicability', 'Human needs']

nodes.name: ExpressEdit enhances novice video editors' ability to express and implement their editing ideas.
The system enables users to perform video edits more efficiently than traditional methods.
ExpressEdit supports idea generation by creating edits based on multimodal user commands.
ExpressEdit: Video Editing with Natural Language and Sketching
Proactive actuation strategies can significantly enhance the inferences made by visual AI sensors in home environments.
Actuation-empowered AIs demonstrate improved robustness in inference accuracy compared to passive sensing systems under varied resident conditions.
AI-to-Human Actuation: Boosting Unmodified AI's Robustness by Proactively Inducing Favorable Human Sensing Conditions
Generative AI models can create new forms of interaction in human-computer interaction.
Generative AI has the potential to enhance user control in interactive systems.
Collaborative exploration of generative AI can lead to valuable research contributions in interaction design.
Architecting Novel Interactions with Generative AI Models
Situated Analytics can improve decision-making processes by providing real-time contextual information in mixed reality environments.
Situated Analytics Process and Mantra
An open-ended AI system enabled a blind child to enhance his capabilities beyond perceived limitations.
The effectiveness of AI capabilities was significantly influenced by the nature of human-AI interaction rather than solely the technology itself.
Design choices play a critical role in facilitating sustained human-AI interaction amid varying uncertainties of AI outputs.
Social Sensemaking with AI: Designing an Open-ended AI Experience with a Blind Child
Grammar-Preserving Text Saliency Modulation (GP-TSM) enhances reading efficiency and user experience.
Participants using GP-TSM exhibit distinct gaze behavior compared to typical reading interfaces, indicating a deeper engagement with the text.
GP-TSM facilitates efficient skimming while enabling users to revisit and engage with previously skipped details.
Why Do Skimmers Perform Better with Grammar-Preserving Text Saliency Modulation (GP-TSM)? Evidence from an Eye Tracking Study
Seamful XAI design process enhances users' ability to foresee AI-related harms.
Users can identify underlying reasons for AI imperfections through the Seamful XAI design process.
Seamful design fosters user agency by allowing users to learn how to leverage information about sociotechnical mismatches in AI.
The process improves explainability of AI systems to end-users by revealing infrastructural mismatches.
Seamful XAI: Operationalizing Seamful Design in Explainable AI
ProactiveAgent utilizes large language models and real-time environmental data to provide personalized reminders and suggestions.
The application enhances user decision-making by offering tailored recommendations based on user history and verbal interactions.
ProactiveAgent captures visual activity and spoken interactions to create context-rich memory storage for better decision support.
In use cases, ProactiveAgent can suggest culinary options aligned with dietary preferences and contextual factors like time.
ProactiveAgent may improve shopping experiences by tracking user attributes and offering insightful product recommendations.
ProactiveAgent: Personalized Context-Aware Reminder System
FINER framework enhances the quality of explanations generated by risk detection classifiers.
FINER facilitates improved malware analysis compared to existing state-of-the-art tools.
FINER: Enhancing State-of-the-art Classifiers with Feature Attribution to Facilitate Security Analysis
Presenting AI recommendations alongside a second opinion can reduce over-reliance on AI by decision-makers.
Decision-makers' under-reliance on AI increases when both AI recommendations and second opinions are presented together.
Allowing decision-makers to control when to solicit second opinions can mitigate over-reliance on AI without increasing under-reliance in some cases.
Does More Advice Help? The Effects of Second Opinions in AI-Assisted Decision Making
The teleoperation system enables monitoring of autonomous driving through virtual reality.
Direct manual control of robotic boats is facilitated by the teleoperation system.
Integration of live sensor data enhances the operational efficiency of the teleoperation system.
Past measurement results can be effectively registered in the virtual representation, improving data accuracy.
VR-based Assistance System for Semi-Autonomous Robotic Boats
